attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
The results of the stock count were as seen below:

  • Bread stock had a variance of -43.5 pieces,
  • Polybags had +365 pieces,
  • Brown ingredient had +0.06  ,
  • wheat bran had +3.07 kgs
  • White and brown flour had -4.39 ,+2.84,  respectively,
  • other raw materials had insignificant variations.

Below is the detailed summary of the audit findings:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management is recommended to ensure proper recording of raw materials is done to avoid the minimal variations noted.
attributes.effect: Minimal variations noted in stock implies that the controls are working effectively, however should be strengthen to ensure nil variations.

value: Stock variations were minimal, we will put more controls to minimise the variances.
Stock controls are ok. However the manager needs to emphasize on minimising the variations.

In the prior audit dated 17/05/2025,the following were noted:

  • Packing material had a surplus of +862 pieces,
  • Bread stock had nil variance,
  • White flour had a deficit of -18.48kgs,
  • Brown flour had a variance of +4.77kgs
  • Wheat bran had a surplus of +4.85kgs,
  • Other stock items had minimal variances.
Current
A physical stock count was conducted on 23/06/2025.
Audit objective was met.
Operations/Production Department
To  determine if physical stock was in agreement with the stock as per SAP and to determine if stock movement controls in place was working effectively.

attributes.title: Crates movement.
attributes.description: It was noted that crates were well controlled however there was significant opening balances as seen below:
attributes.recommendation: Crates movement controls to be maintained, however opening balances should be minimized.
attributes.effect: Nil variations imply that the crates movement is well managed.

value: Crates well controlled.
Crates well controlled.
In the prior audit report it was noted that crates had nil variation however route wise balances were significantly higher.
Current
A physical count of crates held at the branch was done  on 23/06/2025 to determine if they were well controlled and were matching with SAP
Crates well controlled.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if crates were well managed.

attributes.title: Bread weights check
attributes.description: The weight check results were as seen below with Akyda sandwich having a significant underweights:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should ensure correct SOPS are followed to avoid lapses that results in underweight Bread.
attributes.effect:
Underweights exposes the company to non-compliance risk which will attract penalties.

Underweights noted  implies that the branch operating procedures are not strictly followed.

Underweights noted if not addressed can affect brand reputation due to customer dissatisfaction.
attributes.remediation_plan: Ensuring that correct SOPS are strictly followed.

value:
Underweights was caused by oven breakdowns and overcooling.
Overvweights especially in barrels are due to moisure  retainance.
Generally average weights are okey but we will enhance supervision to ensure correct production procedures are followed to avoid underweight bread.
The manager, supervisors and I will enforce spot checks as is the routine to ensure proper weights are achieved our final products.

In the prior audit dated 17/05/2025,Underweights were as seen below:

400 Long had 4% 

4 barrel had 9%

6CTW had 3%

6 BW had 27%
Current
Weight check on packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market was done on 23/06/2025 to determine if they met the standard weight of 200g,400g,600g,800g,1.5Kg as per the KEBs standard weights.

The audit revealed that the Akyda Sandwich 400g had the highest rate of underweight samples at 33.3%, significantly above acceptable limits. This contrasts with other varieties, which maintained underweight levels below 10%. Immediate corrective measures are needed to address this inconsistency and ensure weight compliance.
Operations/Production Department

The objective was to determine if branch was producing bread of correct weight.

To determine if the branch was adhering the standard dividing ranges and that all correct procedures were being followed.

attributes.title: Production efficiency.
attributes.description: It was noted that production efficiency stood at 4.40 which was below the KPI of 4.5 bags per production worker with a cost implication of Kshs.22,818.60  for hiring excess workers as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: Allocation of workers should be strictly done as per the Shift targets to avoid extra costs to the company for hiring excess workers.
attributes.effect: Production efficiency was note achieved by 0.1 which led to hiring of 21 extra workers with a cost implication of KES.22,818.6.

value: Production efficiency is affected by oven breakdowns but the issue was resolved, going forward there will be improvements
We expect improvement although we almost achieved our targets. Am still motivating the team verbally through regular meetings.
In the prior audit dated 17th May 2025,it was noted that production efficiency was at 4.39 which was below the KPI of 4.5 with 17 excess workers hired.
Current
Analysis of production efficiency was done for period of 39 days from 16/05/2025-23/06/2025.
Production efficiency did not attain their KPI ,the company incurred Extra cost of 22,818.6 for hiring extra 21 workers.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if workers allocated to production were achieving their KPI of 4.5 bags per worker.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency.
attributes.description:
The analysis showed that packing efficiency stood at 89.35 crates per packer which was below the KPI of 97 crates per packer,45 extra workers were hired with a cost implication of Kshs.41,040.

A detailed analysis is as seen below:
attributes.recommendation:
Branch management should ensure workers are meeting their KPI to avoid extra costs incured for hiring excess workers.

Proper training of packers should be enforce.
attributes.effect: Workers allocated to packing section was not optimally utilized. The company incurred an extra cost of Kshs.41,040 for hiring extra 41 workers.

value: Packing efficiency is affected by new packers ,we will keep training them to ensure they gain speed.
Packing efficiency is affected by new packers ,we will keep training them to ensure they gain speed.
In the prior audit dated 17th May 2025,it was noted that packing efficiency stood at 93.07 crates per packer.
Current
Packing efficiency was computed for a period of 39 days from 16th May 2025-23rd June 2025.
Workers allocated to packing section was not optimally utilized. The company incurred an extra cost of Kshs.41,040 for hiring extra 41 workers.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if workers allocated to packing section was being fully utilized to avoid extra costs.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart analysis
attributes.description:
It was noted that:

  • Average yield was at 190.46
  • Average daily production in bags was at 103.38 which represents 91.90% production capacity achievement.
  • 150 remixes were noted.

Below is a detailed summary of the audit findings:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should should ensure regular servicing of branch Ovens is done so that it does not affect production.
attributes.effect:
Remixes noted reduces the quality of bread.

Branch production capacity was underutilized.

Average yield was okey.

value: Production capacity under utilized   and remixes noted  were due frequent oven breakdowns.
The ovens needs to be checked/serviced regularly to prevent the breakdowns causing low production.

In the prior audit dated 17th May 2025,it was noted that :

 

Average yield was at 190.45 Loaves per bag.

Production capacity utilization was at 90.12%

636 Remixes were noted.
Current
Analysis of both mixing chart and mixing chart summary was done for a period of 39 days from 16th  May 2025-23rd June 2025.

Remixes noted however minimal reduces the quality of bread.

Branch was underutilized by 9.1125 bags.
Operations/Production Department

To determine if raw material consumption was as per the set BOM and to determine if figures were accurately transfered to the mixing chart summary.

To determine if branch production capacity was being fully utilized.

attributes.title: Vehicles fuel consumption
attributes.description: It was established that fuel consumption was as per the standard rates except for KCF 205 S for Lukenya route and KCP 935 M for airport route Which had consumed  34.58 and 15.14 Litres respectively as illustrated below:
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should ensure fuel allocation be done as per the standard rates and kilometers covered to avoid extra charges to the company for excess fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: Excess fuel consumed implies that controls over fuel allocation should be enhanced.

value:
Vehicle supplying lukenya route(KCF 205 S) had issues with standard consumption rate this was reviewed and there has been changes in the current month.
For airport route(KCP 935) we will do a follow to ensure fuel allocation is done as per the standard rate and distance covered.
Improvement noted. Will continue with follow up.
In the prior audit dated 17/05/2025,it was noted  that as of May 13th, 2025, the Lukenya route vehicle (registration number KCF 205J) recorded excess fuel consumption.
Current
Vehicles fuel analysis was done for a period of 23 days  from 1st June 2025 to 23rd June 2025.
Fuel management was well controlled except KCF  205 S for Lukenya and KCP 935 M for Airport Route that needs to be checked.
Operations/Production Department
The objective was to determine if fuel allocation was being done as per the standard consumption rates and predetermined distance in Kilometres.

attributes.title: Bread damages Analysis
attributes.description:
It was established that production damages stood at 0.203  % of total production  which was slightly above allowable range while market damages stood at 0.51% of total sales which was slightly above the allowable threshold of 0.5% with a cost implication of Kshs.4,937.38

Below is a detailed summary of the audit finding:

N/B the above analysis is exclusive of 646 Pieces of Oven damages.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to ensure they are adhering to the standard production procedures to avoid lapses that will reduce bread quality therefore leading to excess damages.
attributes.effect:
Production damages within the limits implies that the branch management is producing bread of good quality.

Market damages above the allowable limits implies that improper handling of bread by sales team.

value: Market damages are slightly higher due to quality which at times is compromised by the regular breakdowns of the ovens(MBN 250 and MBN 251)
Market damages are slightly higher due to quality which at times is compromised by the regular breakdowns of the ovens(MBN 250 and MBN 251)

In the prior audit it was noted that production damages was at 0.20% which was within the allowable thresh hold while market damages was at 0.81% of total sales which was above the allowable threshhold of 0.5% of total sales.
Current
Damages  analysis was done for a period of 39 days from 16th May 2025 to 23rd June 2025.
Market damages was above the allowable limits by 0.01 % while market damages were within the allowable limits.
Operations/Production Department
To determine if Production and market damages were within the allowable limits of 0.2% of total production while Market damages were within 0.5% of total sales.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description: It was observed that cash at hand was tallying with cash flow balance, there were no pending IOUS as detailed below:
attributes.effect: Nil variation noted implies that cash controls are working effectively.

value: Controls are working effectively.
Controls are working effectively.
Noted, cashier to keep up good controls.
Current
A Spot check was done at cash office on 24/06/2025.
Cash controls working effectively to be maintained.
Operations/Production Department

To determine if cash as per cashflow  was in agreement with cash held at hand.

To determine if cash controls in place were working effectively.
